TopicTitle: [WIP][1.9.x-1.12.x] Scatterer-atmospheric scattering (0.0838 - 14/08/2022) Scattering improvements, in-game atmo generation and multi-sun support

Sorry, I didn't realize macs ran openGL or else I wouldn't have posted. Sorry for the waste of time

I ran into a bit of an odd issue with Scatterer last night. When I ended a mission, I would be unable to use any of the building screens (Mission Control, Kerbonaut Complex, R&D Center...). The window would initially open, but then start flickering whenever I moved the mouse. I removed Scatterer and the issue went away, but I'd really like to be able to put it back, as it makes everything look so much nicer.

Kerbal Space Program - 1.1.0.1196 x64  

OS: Windows 7 Service Pack 1 (6.1.7601) 64bit  

CPU: Intel(R) Core(TM) i5-3570 CPU @ 3.40GHz (4)  

RAM: 8153  

GPU: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 650 (1989MB)

After i test today new eve version & post a wrong issue in wrong place, [@rbray89](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/48847-rbray89/)  mea culpa , getting sloppy coz hey making test with out drink any coffe is baaad idea, were is my coffe my sweeet coofeee (golum voice), i was decide to dig more & in end i found 1196 + Scatter create wierd shadow. I seen this issue appear in 1196 but at that time i was concern by other problem & from reading your post i was not want to post about belive a new version it will be release aka better to wait a litle but now coz i make that mistake in eve section i was decide to adress to you ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

A. Test done with:  

Scatterer v1.0.5939.25400 + CompiledAtmosphericScatter.shader extra file use what fix horizon dots  

Eve: v1.5.5946.5364  

Stock Visual Enhancements v0.5.8 Ultra Resolution  

DistantObject v1.7.0.19328  

AmbientLightAdjustment v2.5.6.3  

PlanetShine v1.0.5938.30099

![O6rle6W.png](http://i.imgur.com/O6rle6W.png)

B. Test with Scatterer + GCMonitor + MM what confirm this is came from Scatter, if i remove Scatter problem is gone

![WDGctZ7.png](http://i.imgur.com/WDGctZ7.png)

logs: [https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B9RK2PFOUhe3RHBNMHRpclhyVDA/view?usp=sharing](https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B9RK2PFOUhe3RHBNMHRpclhyVDA/view?usp=sharing)

p.s. i am still zombi cooz noo coffe & damn parrot was succed to get out from his room, lesson learn do not doo test with out drink coofffeeee!!!

**Edited <time datetime="2016-04-12T18:17:04Z" title="04/12/2016 06:17  PM" data-short="8 yr">April 12, 2016</time> by blackrack**

<iframe class="imgur-album" frameborder="0" height="550" src="//imgur.com/a/blqS3/embed?background=ffffff&text=1a1a1a&link=4e76c9" width="100%"></iframe>

Hello I am a first time Scatterer user thanks to 1.1 now being 64bit on Mac. First off I can't imagine you get tired of hearing this....this mod is gorgeous! I have always wanted to use it but having a MBP my computer really couldn't handle it. Now with 64bit I am excited to add it to my save file. I have looked back quite a few pages and i have not seen this issue reported. So I apologize if has already been reported. I am seeing a pink square on the launchpad and runway. It shows up at other odd times and usually too fast for me to catch a screen shot. But it does consistently happen on the launchpad and runway. It definitely doesn't happen without scatterer installed. Thanks for this great mod keep up the great work.

Mid 2012 MBP OSX El Capitan

Scatterer Version 0.0242

KSP.log [https://www.dropbox.com/s/pcybc65bdg6owx6/KSP.log?dl=0](https://www.dropbox.com/s/pcybc65bdg6owx6/KSP.log?dl=0)

Player.log [https://www.dropbox.com/s/j9pm1i59c04ycoi/Player.log?dl=0](https://www.dropbox.com/s/j9pm1i59c04ycoi/Player.log?dl=0)

EDIT: It seems that the Lens Flare Shader seems to be the culprit. Turning it off seems to fix the pink box. Awesome!

**Edited <time datetime="2016-04-13T01:41:13Z" title="04/13/2016 01:41  AM" data-short="8 yr">April 13, 2016</time> by sp1989**

> 
> 
> 1 hour ago, sp1989 said:
> 
> 
> EDIT: It seems that the Lens Flare Shader seems to be the culprit. Turning it off seems to fix the pink box. Awesome!
> 

This issue pops up from time to time, mostly for OpengGL users (mac/linux), not sure what really causes it but with OpenGL support for windows broken It's hard for me to pinpoint the issue.

Ok. So is it the Lens Flare Shader and OpenGL? Or just OpenGL. Turning off the lens flare shader did the trick the pink box is gone. One other thing I am noticing though is graphics glitch when staging. Whenever I stage the screen kinda glitches. I don't know how to describe it. Its kinda blink and you will miss it thing and too fast to get a screen shot of. The screen doesn't exactly go black but I suppose I could describe it as large  transparent artifacts showing up on the left side and top right of the screen whenever I stage. Again its really fast and they don't stay. Staging in space its all normal really it only happens during takeoff. I am not too concerned about it because again it really fast and it only happens during takeoff. But I just feel I should report it and maybe other people are experiencing this too.

> 
>

Haven't used OpenGL in a while (pre-1.0) but from what I remember, anytime you have odd magenta things happening, it's a safe bet to assume it has something to do with OpenGL. I think, when I was using OpenGL, the rotate gizmo was the normal 3 circles, but instead of them wrapping around an invisible sphere, they were wrapped around a magenta sphere.

This is the graphics glitch i was talking about. It only happens at staging and again its really quick and doesn't cause a crash or really effect the performance of the game. However its still not normal and should happen because it doesn't happen in stock KSP. Sorry there is no sound just watch for the staging.
